thread.title: Lower Saucon Twp, PA – Multi-Vehicle Accident With Injuries on I-78 EB at MM 71.6
thread.title_full: Lower Saucon Twp, PA – Multi-Vehicle Accident With Injuries on I-78 EB at MM 71.6

author: Harvey Barbee
title: Lower Saucon Twp, PA – Multi-Vehicle Accident With Injuries on I-78 EB at MM 71.6
text:
Lower Saucon Twp, PA (December 19, 2024) – Emergency crews responded to a two-vehicle accident with injuries on I-78 Eastbound near mile marker 71.6 in Lower Saucon Township at approximately 6:48 p.m. Pennsylvania State Police (PSP), Fire Units 16 and 13, along with EMS 1384 and EMS 17, were dispatched to the scene.
Initial reports indicated multiple injuries. By 7:11 p.m., EMS 1384 requested an additional EMS unit to assist, confirming three patients requiring medical attention. Emergency personnel worked to provide care for the injured and manage traffic in the area. The condition of the patients and the severity of their injuries have not yet been disclosed.
Motorists traveling on I-78 Eastbound are advised to expect delays as the area remains active with emergency operations. Our thoughts are with those injured in this accident.
Multi-Vehicle Accidents in Pennsylvania Highways like I-78 often see multi-vehicle accidents due to factors such as heavy traffic, speeding, or adverse weather conditions. These crashes frequently result in injuries requiring prompt medical care and emergency response coordination.
To reduce the risk of such incidents, authorities encourage drivers to maintain safe speeds, avoid distractions, and remain alert to road conditions.
For those involved in multi-vehicle accidents, seeking immediate medical treatment, documenting the incident, and consulting legal professionals are essential steps toward recovery and resolution.
For more information or to receive help after an accident, contact Local Accident Reports. If you or someone you know has been injured in a crash, reach out to Local Accident Reports for assistance.
